description.narrative: 1. Technology transfer and enhancing India''s competitiveness: Innovation and technological ability are critical to the development of off-highway tires, a high-value niche segment of the global tire industry. The Project will increase the competitiveness of the Indian OHT manufacturing sector as a result of shared R & D and technology between ATC India and its associate companies, Alliance Tire Company Ltd., Israel and Alliance Tire Americas Inc., USA. 2. Employment generation: The Project will create direct employment for about 850 people. ATG is committed to developing and strengthening its employees'' technical expertise and engineers from each of its Israel and India facilities are often sent to the other location to conduct training. In addition, the Project will create temporary employment during its construction phase. 3. Agricultural productivity: Almost 60% of ATG''s sales are to the agriculture equipment sector, where increasing productivity is critical to meet increasing food demand. ATG invests significant resources in its research and development and conducts extensive testing to ensure its tires are designed to increase the productivity of the equipment on which they are used.

Alliance Tire Group (ATG or the Company) manufactures off-highway tires that are used in agricultural, forestry, construction and earth-moving equipment. ATG has a 48,000 tonnes per annum (tpa) plant in India in a Special Economic Zone (SEZ) near Tirunelveli, India that is in the process of being expanded to 61,000 tpa and 35,000 tpa plant near Hadera, Israel. The Company plans to expand its Indian operations via: (i) the construction of a greenfield plant with a capacity of 50,000 tpa in Jhagadia Kharchi Extension in Gujarat; (ii) a further expansion of 29,000 tpa in Tirunelveli; and (iii) the installation of a cogeneration plant at Tirunelveli (the Project).
